intro: Silene microloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaf catchfly, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and meadows. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Silene microloba is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
